channel.title: Ubuntu Christian Edition
channel.description:
I recently converted to this new distro. It's very cool. The reason I converted is because I'm Christian
Discuss [url=http://www.whatwouldjesusdownload.com/christianubuntu/2006/07/about-ubuntu-christian-edition.html]Ubuntu Christian Edition[/url]

item.title: Ubuntu Christian Edition
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“Rictoo, post:41, topic:10049”][quote author=Ron link=topic=14585.msg261086#msg261086 date=1158830586]

And what makes you think God is happy about cars and airplanes? Maybe we would be better off without them.

Maybe we should run around naked too. C’mon let’s go! We can be like Adam and Eve.

Oh and don’t forget the Pope supposively is the only one with a direct link to god. And about 20 yrs after the plane was invented, the pope then got the consent from god that air planes were deemed “OK”. You must know what you are talking about before arguing with someone who knows his shit inside and out.
[/quote]

Pope = Bishop of Catholic Church.
Remember, there was something before the Roman Church broke away from the rest of the 4.

This, http://www.saintignatiuschurch.org/timeline.html, is perfectly true to history. Read a History book :P[/quote]

Exageration and sarcasm don’t seem to come by your mind.

Religion is pretty much bullshit to me, but by what I said in what you quoted, you basically get my point. I really don’t care about semantics.

Read full topic

And what makes you think God is happy about cars and airplanes? Maybe we would be better off without them.
[/quote]
Maybe we should run around naked too. C’mon let’s go! We can be like Adam and Eve.

Oh and don’t forget the Pope supposively is the only one with a direct link to god. And about 20 yrs after the plane was invented, the pope then got the consent from god that air planes were deemed “OK”. You must know what you are talking about before arguing with someone who knows his shit inside and out. :D[/quote]

Pope = Bishop of Catholic Church.
Remember, there was something before the Roman Church broke away from the rest of the 4.

This, http://www.saintignatiuschurch.org/timeline.html, is perfectly true to history. Read a History book

item.title: Ubuntu Christian Edition
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

[quote=“Zach1188, post:13, topic:10049”][quote author=Ron link=topic=14585.msg175359#msg175359 date=1156226283]

i didnt think christians believed in computers

Yup at once point they believed the world was flat and they still don’t believe in evolution and a bunch of other crap. :rolleyes:

“If god wanted us to fly, he would have given us wings.” - Very old saying from a previous Pope.

He said that and still used his car. Soo… “If god wanted us to drive, he should have given us wheels.” :rolleyes:
[/quote]
And that’s exactly why I’m not a christian :P.

(Wasn’t meant to insult anyone :))[/quote]

And what makes you think God is happy about cars and airplanes? Maybe we would be better off without them.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Christian Edition
item.dc:creator: @papetowe papetowe
item.description:
@papetowe wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:19, topic:10049”]I never even used KDE, I figured the original would be best. Plus if I had any problems, the people with KDE are a much smaller community than the ones with just Ubuntu.

i hate this os now…reinstalled ubuntu then installed KDE

No screenshots? Nothing? lol.

I could just picture some of the error messages.

“WTF are you doing on the computer on a Sunday, get your fat ass in church!”

I could also picture some of the help on their forum.

“I got a virus, what do I do?”

“Looks like you sinnedrecently, have you confessed and prayed?” :rolleyes:[/quote]
Since when do christians make confessions?

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Christian Edition
item.dc:creator: @Drunk_On_Java Drunk On Java
item.description:
@Drunk_On_Java wrote:

[quote=“Taylor, post:24, topic:10049”][quote author=Drunk On Java link=topic=14585.msg177348#msg177348 date=1156290471]
Don’t get Kubuntu (KDE Ubuntu) it’s to child-like.
[/quote]i bet you never tried it[/quote]

Actually I have made my own Linux live-cd with KDE in it. If you get Gnome you can switch the taskbar to the bottom like I did.

I mean the graphics are child like. Like beeing to to cute.

Read full topic
